tags.name: One-time tokens
tags.description: One-time tokens are used for various authentication and verification purposes. They are typically sent via email and have an expiration time.

post.description: Create a new one-time token associated with an email address. The token can be used for verification purposes and has an expiration time.

email.description: The email address to associate with the one-time token.

expiresIn.description: The expiration time in seconds. If not provided, defaults to 2 days (172,800 seconds).

context.description: Additional context to store with the one-time token. This can be used to store arbitrary data that will be associated with the token.

201.description: The one-time token was created successfully.

get.description: Get a one-time token by its ID.

200.description: The one-time token found by ID.

post.description: Verify a one-time token associated with an email address. If the token is valid and not expired, it will be marked as consumed.

email.description: The email address associated with the one-time token.

200.description: The one-time token was verified successfully.

put.description: Update the status of a one-time token by its ID. This can be used to mark the token as consumed or expired.

status.description: The new status of the one-time token.

200.description: The one-time token status was updated successfully.
